episode_title: 224 - The One With Barry and Mindy’s Wedding

content.description: Central Perk, the whole gang is there as Joey enters

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Joey, how’d the audition go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Incredible! I met the director this time and you’ll never believe who it was.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. I’ll give you one hint. Warren Beatty.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, there’s just one thing that might be kind’ve a problem. See, I, uh, had to kiss this guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ’Cause he was just so darn cute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, as part of the audition. See, I’m up for this part of this guy, who the main guy kisses.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, hey. You’re an actor, I say you just suck it up and do it. (Rachel looks at him in disbelief) Or you just do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I did do it, I’m a professional.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then what’s the problem?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See after the scene, Mr. Beatty comes up to me and says ‘good actor, bad kisser’. Can you believe that, me not a good kisser, that’s like, like Mother Theresa, not a good mother.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, come on, who cares what that guy thinks. What does Warren Beatty know about kissing (Chandler and Monica, give her a look that says ‘think about it’) Ooh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, what did your agent say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep, this kiss thing is defiantly a problem, Mr. Beatty wants to see it again on Monday. Man, I gotta figure out what I’m doing wrong. Oh, okay, one of you girls come over here and kiss me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What, forget it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, I need your help here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. I’ll do it, I kissed him before I can do it again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You see this, this is a friend.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, let’s go. (they move in to kiss) Oh, wait I have gum. Okay. (they kiss rather passionately) Good, very good, firm but tender. I’d recommend you to a friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then I don’t know what it is. What’s the problem?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, you know, maybe your just not used to kissing men, maybe you just tensed up a little, maybe that’s what you need to work on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that makes sense. (looks at Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Over my dead body! (Joey looks at Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I’ll be using his dead body as a shield.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe, Monica, and Richard are there

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on out, honey! I’m telling you look good! (turns around, and under his breath, to the rest of the guys) Tell her she looks good, tell her she looks good.

(Rachel enters in this hideous pink bride’s maid dress, with a huge silver bow on her chest, and a big, huge skirt, kinda like the one’s women wore in the 1800s, Monica and Richard both stare in shock)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, you look so good!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can not believe I have to walk down the aisle in front of 200 people looking like something you drink when your nauseous.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So don’t, I don’t see why we have to go to this thing anyway, it’s your ex-fiancee’s wedding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because I promised Mindy I would.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well you promised Barry, you’d marry him. (Rachel glares at her, and she retreats to safety between Richard’s legs)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look you guys, I have to go, I’m the Maid-of-Honor. And besides you know what I just need to be in a room again with these people and feel good about myself.
(Chandler enters, sees Rachel in the dress and starts laughing)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh-oh! Someone’s wearing the same clothes they had on last night. Someone get a little action?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I may have.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Woo-hoo, stuud!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s she look like?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we haven’t exactly met, we just stayed up all night talking on the internet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Woo-hoo, geeek!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I like this girl, okay, I seriously like this girl, you now how sometimes I tend get a little defended and quipy…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well she totally called me on it, okay. She said, ‘cut it out, get real’, and I did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! What’s that like?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s like this, me, no jokes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, stop it, you’re freaking me out.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, yeah, I don’t like you this way. All right, I’ll see you guys later.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bye, Richard.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye sweetie, (kisses him) I love you.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I love you, too.
(Monica stares longingly at the door, after Richard leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think my boyfriend ever so dreamy, I wonder what our wedding’s gonna be like.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about? What wedding?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, like you never talk that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooo! Never! I mean, we’re living in the moment. God, it is so nice for once to not have to get all hung up on ‘Where is this going?’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Afraid to ask him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Could not be more terrified.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think you should seriously consider the marriage thing, give Rachel another chance to dress up like Princess Bubble Yum.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Richard and Monica are playing with Ben.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where’s Benny? (drops the blanket) There he is! (does it again) Where’s Benny, there he is.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Awww! You know that’s probably why babies learn to talk, so they can tell grown ups to cut it out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, you know I got a question for ya. Just a little thing, no pressure.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you ever, uh, like, think about the future?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Sure I do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, am I in it?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Honey, you are in it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, you are about to get sooo lucky.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Keep talkin’.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, uh, sometimes I think about selling my practice, we could move to France, make French toast.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so, uh, we’re in France, we’re making the toast. Do you see a little bassinet in the corner?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Like a hound?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not a basset, a bassinet.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You really need the bassinet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I just think the baby would keep falling off the dog. Do you, uh, do you , do you not see kids in our future.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, hey. I love children, I have children. I just don’t want to be 70 when our kids go off to college, and our lives can finally start.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Look I want you, now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Great. You know we don’t need to talk about this now. Really, I mean this is, is so way, way, way, in the future, I’m talkin’ hovercrafts and apes taking over the planet.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are there, Chandler is talking to his new friend on the internet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, Chandler, I want this part soo much. (Chandler ignores him) Just one kiss, I won’t tell anyone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, no means no!
[Rachel, in her bridesmaid dress, complete with hat, which makes her look like Little Bo Peep, and Ross enter]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry we, we don’t have your sheep.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, Rach, I think you look cute (kisses her on the cheek, then looks at Ross) And you, uh, you, you I could eat with a spoon (goes to kiss him).

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get away from me I said no!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Richard buzzed. He’s waiting downstairs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, Richard’s here. I should run down say bye to him (runs out)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye, good luck.
(Rachel, Ross, and Monica exit)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how’s your date with your cyberchick going. Ooh, hey, what is all that (points at the computer screen).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s a website, it’s the, uh, the Guggenheim museum. See, she likes art, and I like funny words.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What does she mean by HH?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It means we’re holding hands.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you the cutest?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m afraid I might just be.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, what I think is so great that you are totally into this person and yet for all you know she could be like 90 years old, or have two heads, or. It could be a guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, it’s not a guy, all right, I know her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It could be like a big giant guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, I got this close to him (holds up his fingers) and Monica kneed me in the back. What’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We were just wondering if Chandler’s girlfriend is a girl.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, well. Just ask her how long she’s gonna live. Women live longer than men.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do you not fall down more?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, ask her ‘What is her current method of birth control?’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. (reading her answer) “My husband is sleeping with his secretary.” She’s married!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well at least we know she’s a woman.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe she’s married.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aw, man I’m sorry (starts rubbing Chandler’s shoulder). This must be very tough for ya, huh (and starts comfroting him looking for a kiss).

content.description: Barry and Mindy’s wedding, Monica and Richard are standing in the lobby

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, I read this article in the paper the other day that says you’re not supposed to throw rice at weddings, because when pigeons eat rice it kills them.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, that’s why you never see pigeons at sushi bars.(they both start laughing at Richard’s poor joke) See, we’re having fun.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, absolutely. Yeah, you know I’m not even thinking about that thing that we’re not supposed to think about.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Neither am I.

content.description: later the bridesmaids and ushers are getting ready to start, Ross is looking for Rachel

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, when I was in the bathroom I saw the window that I crawled out of at my wedding, and God, I just started thinking that I shouldn’t be here, you know I shouldn’t, people are going to be looking at me and judging me and, and thinking about the last time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sweetie, it’s be gonna okay, all right. It’s a wedding, generally people focus on the bride.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God I know, you’re right.
(Annoying wedding planner enters)

content.speaker: Wedding Planner
content.text: All rightie, everybody look at me. Good. All right, its time. Bridesmaids and ushers let’s see two lines, thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you after the thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, good luck (kisses her and leaves)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you, Okay, Okay.
[Starts to walk down the aisle, unfortunately she doesn’t realize that her dress is bunched up in her underwear and her butt is showing.]

content.description: after the wedding, Ross and Rachel are in the lobby

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why the hell didn’t you tell me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry. What was I supposed to do stand up and shout ‘Hey, Rachel, your butt is showing!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God this is sooo humiliating. I think the only thing that tops that was, was, was when I was in the eight grade and I had to sing the Copa Cabana in front of the entire school. I think I got about two lines into it before I ran and freaked out. Oh my God, my entire life is flashing before my eyes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, hey look, I remember that, it wasn’t so bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, would you stop, you got me, I’m dating you.

content.speaker: Mr. Wineburg
content.text: Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hi, Mr. Wineburg, hi Mrs. Wineburg.

content.speaker: Mr. Wineburg
content.text: It’s so wonderful to see you again, my dear, in fact I hardly expected to see so much.

content.speaker: Mrs. Wineburg
content.text: You told me you didn’t see anything.

content.speaker: Mr. Wineburg
content.text: I tell ya a lot things!

content.speaker: Mrs. Wineburg
content.text: Well it’s wonderful to have you up and about, again, dear.

content.speaker: Mr. Wineburg
content.text: Stay well.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, now that is the third time someone has said something like that to me today.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Rach! Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi!

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Oh my God, I’m married!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: I’m Mrs. Dr. Barry Hunter hyphen Farber.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, I’m so proud of you, Min.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Min. Oh Rach, you’re still here, at our wedding, they were packing up the chopped liver about now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I love that story. Um, I got a question for you guys. Why do people keep is saying that is good to see me up and about?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Well uh, after you ran out on your wedding, Barry’s parents told people that you were sort of…insane.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Insane!

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: …from the syphilis.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Yeah, what are they gonna say you didn’t love me anymore. Come on.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are there, Joey is on the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Angela? Joey Tribiani. Listen, what are ya doing tonight. I know your seeing that guy I was thinking maybe you could bring him…Hello? Hello? (picks up a statue of an Indian and walks into his room)
(the computer bing, bongs)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aren’t you gonna answer her, that’s like the tenth bing-bong message she sent. She wants to know what’s wrong?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s wrong? What’s wrong? You’re married that’s what’s wrong.
(bing, bong)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, my.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She wants to meet you in person.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, Phoebe I wanted to meet her in person too, okay, but she’s married, she has a husband.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What if the husband person is the wrong guy, and you are the right guy. I mean you don’t get chances like this all the time, if you don’t meet her now, you’re gonna be kicking yourself when your 80, which is hard to do, and that’s how you break a hip.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’ll do it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah! Okay! Great! Go, man, go put on your shoes, and, and march out there and meet her! (Chandler runs and picks up his shoes) Oh, wait, no, no you have to take a shower, ’cause, eww. (Chandler runs to the bathroom, as the computer bing-bongs) No, you know what you have to answer her, answer her first. (Chandler runs to the computer) No, no, you know what make some coffee ’cause its too much. (Chandler walks slowly into the kitchen)

content.description: at Barry and Mindy’s reception, Monica and Richard are sitting at a table, and Monica is trying to throw a piece of candy into his mouth.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, one more, please. Come on, I’m gonna get it in this time, I will.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay, last chance. (Monica throws the candy and hits some woman in the back of the head, Richard turns around and says) Again, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what, maybe I don’t need to have children. You know maybe I just think I do because that is what society, and by that I mean my mom, has always convinced me that I…(sees two little girls dancing together) I do, I have to have children, I’m sorry, I just do.

content.speaker: Best Man
content.text: Yo! Can I have your attention, please, Best Man, making a toast here. Thank you. (clears throat, and starts reading his toast) I remember when Barry got home from his first date with Rachel…

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Best Man
content.text: What, (to Barry) you hired the same band I can’t use the same speech. (gets a ’da-doom-chesh’ from the drummer) Thank you, thank you very much. Anyway, I wish you both a wonderful life together. And Rachel…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What.

content.speaker: Best Man
content.text: No, no, no now in all seriousness, its not a lot of women would’ve had the guts to come back here tonight, and even fewer, who would do it with their asses hanging out! (da-doom-chesh)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, I like to, uh, to add something to that…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why are you adding, why are you adding, why are you adding, why are you adding?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Most of you don’t know me, I’m Rachel’s boyfriend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh dear God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ross, uh and uh, I’d just like to say that it did take a lot of courage for Rachel to come here tonight. And, uh, for the record she did not run out on Barry because she had syphilis. (da-doom-chesh) (to drummer) What are you doing I’m serious. Uh, the reason she walked out on, on Barry is simply that she didn’t love him, which incidentally worked out pretty well for me (looks for the da-doom-chesh, and doesn’t get one) Cheers.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She you in the parking lot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, Rach!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: And once again she is out of here. Okay who had 9:45? Um?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ya, know what Barr, I’m not gonna leave. I probably should, but I’m not, see ’cause I promised myself that I would make it through at least *one* of your weddings (da-doom-chesh). See now, tonight, all I really wanted was to make it though this evening with a little bit of grace and dignity. Well (laughing), I guess we can all agree that’s not gonna happen. There’s nothing really left to say except…(starts singing) “Her name was Lola. She was a showgirl. With yellow feathers (band joins in), feathers in her hair, and a dress cut down to there. She would…”
content.parenthetical: after a pause with everyone staring at her, she goes up to the microphone

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marenge,

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “…marenge, thank you honey, and do the cha-cha. And while she like to be a star, Tony always tended bar. At the, wait, wait, everybody..”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Everybody!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: At the Copa, Copa Cabana (everyone joins in) The hottest spot north of Havana. At the Copa, Coo-pa Ca-ban-a, music and fashion were always the passion, at the Copa…

content.description: later, Richard and Monica are dancing

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay, I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ll do what?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: If kids is what I takes to be with you then kids it is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: If I have to I’ll, I’ll do all again , I’ll do the 4 o’clock feeding thing, I’ll go to the P.T.A. meetings, I’ll coach the soccer team.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah, if I have to. Monica, I don’t wanna lose you, so if I have to do it all over again, then I will.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re the most wonderful man. And if you hadn’t of said ‘if I have to’ like seventeen times, then I’d be saying ‘okay, let’s do it.’

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: But you’re not.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, I can’t believe what I’m getting ready to say. I wanna have a baby, but I don’t wanna have one with someone who doesn’t really wanna have one.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: God. I love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know you do. Me too. (pause) So what now?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I guess we just keep dancing.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Rachel, Ross, Joey, and Phoebe are there waiting for Chandler’s cyberchick to arrive

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where is she, Where is she? (grabs Rachel) Oh, hey, I have a question, where is she?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, relax, Chandler, she’ll be here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, oh, oh, that’s her.
content.parenthetical: noticing a beautiful blond walking in

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, ’cause life’s just that kind.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, you gotta stop staring at the door. It’s like a watched pot, you know if you keep looking at it then the door is to, never gonna boil. I think what you have to do is try not to…
(Chandler’s date walks in)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! (it’s Janice)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: OH…MY…GAWD!! (Chandler rushes over and kisses her)

content.speaker: All
content.text: OH…MY…GOD!!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is reading a script as Ross enters

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right I’ve been feeling incredibly guilty about this, because I wanna be a good friend, and dammit I am a good friend. So just, just shut up and close your eyes (kisses Joey).

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, you are a good friend, ’course the audition was this morning, and I didn’t get it. But that was a hell of a kiss. Rachel is a very lucky girl.
